result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith D Burks Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith D Burks Jr in court.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appeared by phone for Keith D Burks Jr.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense unable to appear due to illness. Defense request additional date. Court grants. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense counsel contacted the Court and requested an adjournment. Court grants the request. Case adjourned and remains calendared in Br 4. Parties advised of the new date and time.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keith D Burks in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keith D Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Keith D Burks in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense contacted court to request adjournment. Court granted adjournment. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Keith D Burks in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keith D Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028533,
Payable Number: 994754,
Receipt Number: 22RP011929,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant previously posted $3,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 remain on deposit and that $2,000 be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Keith D Burks in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
